title: Executive Order 8624-Making Certain Changes in the Organization of Customs Collection District No. 26 (Arizona)
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by section 1 of the act of August 1, 1914, 38 Stat. 609, 623 (U.S.C., title 19, sec. 2), it is ordered that the following changes be, and they are hereby, made in the organization of Customs Collection District No. 26 (Arizona):
1. The designation of the town of Ajo, Arizona, as a customs port of entry is revoked.
2. The town of Sonoyta, Arizona, is designated as a customs port of entry.
This order shall become effective as of January 1, 1941.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8624-Making Certain Changes in the Organization of Customs Collection District No. 26 (Arizona) Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/210416
